page.title: 14THE LOCAL GUN CLUB
page.content: THE CLUB IS CALLED THE DENNETT VALLEY GUN CLUB AND HAS BEEN IN EXISTENCE FOR TEN YEARS.THERE ARE FORTY-FIVE MEMBERS EACH OF WHOM HAS HIS OWN SHOTGUN WHICH MUST BE LICENSED BY THE POLICE.STRICT CONTROLS ARE EXERCISED OVER THE SUPPLY AND USE OF AMMUNITION.THE CLUB ITSELF IS RUN BY A MANAGEMENT COMMITTEE WHICH ORGANISES ACTIVITIES,FUND-RAISING ETC. A CLAY-PIGEON SHOOT IS HELD ONCE A MONTH WITH THE PRACTICE ON A WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THE COMPETITION ON THE FOLLOWING SATURDAY.SOME EVENTS ARE "CLOSED",MEANING ONLY CLUB MEMBERS CAN PARTICIPATE WHILE OTHERS ARE "OPEN". THESE ATTRACT ENTRIES FROM FAR AND WIDE. ALTHOUGH THE CLUB IS STILL RELATIVELY YOUNG AND LACKS FACILITIES THE COMMITTEE HOPE TO RAISE FUNDS FOR IMPROVEMENTS AND LOOK FORWARD TO BECOMING WELL- ESTABLISHED.
